item.title: Prevalence of H.pylori infection in Japan by birth cohort, from 1908 to 2003 -- a systematic review and meta-regression analysis
item.description: Introduction Changing time trends in the prevalence of H.pylori infection in the general population is thought to be the main driving force behind the declined gastric cancer mortality in Japan. However, whether the prevalence of H.pylori infection itself showed a birth cohort pattern remains inadequately studied. Methods We performed a systematic review and meta-analysis of the prevalence of H.pylori infection among Japanese subjects. Potential studies eligible for inclusion included population-based cohort studies, cross-sectional studies, and case-control studies.
